SEARCH
Module com.mc.InventorySystem
Package com.mc.controller

Class MainMenuController

java.lang.Object
com.mc.controller.MainMenuController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MainMenuController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The controller class for the Main Menu scene. Handles user interactions with the main menu screen, such as navigating to other screens and searching for parts and products.
Author:
Michael Cassidy

    • MainMenuController

      public MainMenuController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Initializes the controller class. Sets the items of the partTable and prodTable to all parts and all products in Inventory respectively. Sets the cell value factories for each column in the tables. Adds listeners to the partField and prodField to trigger a search filter when the text changes.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - The location of the FXML file.
      resources - The ResourceBundle for the FXML file.

    • partSearchFieldListener

      private void partSearchFieldListener()
      Listener method for the search field in the Parts table. Updates the table to display the search results.

    • prodSearchFieldListener

      private void prodSearchFieldListener()
      Listener method for the search field in the Products table. Updates the table to display the search results.

    • onActionAddPart

      private void onActionAddPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Opens the "Add Part" window when the "Add" button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      event - the event that triggered this method
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • onActionAddProduct

      private void onActionAddProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Event handler for the "Add Product" button. Navigates to the AddProduct.fxml scene.
      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent triggered by the user clicking the "Add Product" button
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs when loading the AddProduct.fxml file

    • onActionDeletePart

      private void onActionDeletePart()
      Handles the "Delete" button action in the Parts tab. Deletes the selected part from the Inventory and notifies the user if the part was deleted successfully or not. If no part is selected, it displays a message to the user to select a part.

    • onActionDeleteProduct

      private void onActionDeleteProduct()
      Deletes the selected product from the product table and the Inventory. Notifies the user with an alert message of whether the product was deleted or not.

    • onActionModifyPart

      private void onActionModifyPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Event handler for modifying a part. Gets the selected part from the table and loads the ModifyPart.fxml scene to modify the part. Sets the part and its index to ModifyPartController. Shows the new scene to the user.
      Parameters:
      event - The event that triggers the method call.

    • onActionModifyProduct

      private void onActionModifyProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method opens the ModifyProduct.fxml view and sets the selected product's information to be displayed in the fields for editing. It takes an ActionEvent parameter, which is the event generated by the user clicking the "Modify" button on the main screen. It then uses the selected product to set the initial values of the fields in the ModifyProduct.fxml view, so that the user can edit the product's information. The method catches any exceptions that may occur and notifies the user if a product has not been selected for modification.
      Parameters:
      event - The event that triggers the method call.

    • onActionExit

      private void onActionExit()
      Exits application
